title: iris_yellow
body: Diana Martines is a part-time fashion model whose feral appearance gives her access to a number of clawing and agility-based techniques. She is also skilled with a whip, and is accompanied by her pet fox "Fin". Her battle download allows her to hasten the entire party, drastically improving the attack speed of all party members for a limited time. During her Fin Attack, the fox begins to glow and then streaks across the screen, briefly attacking all enemies.

title: pasca_kanonno
body:
The co-protagonist of the [[tales_of_the_world_radiant_mythology|first Radiant Mythology]] spin-off of the [[tales of (series)|Tales of series]]. She makes an appearance in the [[tales_of_the_world_radiant_mythology_2|second]] and [[tales_of_the_world_radiant_mythology_3|third]] installments in a fashion similar to the other Tales characters. Since this Kanonno has no given last name, Pasca (her homeworld) is used for the sake of identification.

Compared to the other Kanonnos, Pasca Kanonno has a spring motif. This Kanonno's Character Voice is [b]Kudō Haruka[/b]

h4. See Also

* [[Kanonno Earhart]]
* [[Kanonno Grassvalley]]

title: shuna_no_tabi
body:
シュナの旅 (しゅな の たび)

Single volume full-color manga written by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] in 1983. Contains several similarities in characters, setting, and themes with [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]], [[Mononoke Hime]], and [[Gedo Senki]]. It tells the story of a prince who travels in search of the Golden Wheat to save his people from starving. The English title has been rendered as "The Journey of Shuna"/"Shuna's Journey".

title: ashley_winchester
body: The main protagonist of [[Wild Arms 2]], and one of the founding members of ARMS alongside [[Brad Evans]] and [[Lilka Eleniak]]. Ashley is a soldier for Meria's king who becomes possessed by Lord Blazer, the game's main antagonist. This evil is kept in check by the holy power of the Sword Magess's sword Argetlahm. Ashley struggles with the two halves while leading ARMS, resolving his feelings for [[Marina Irington]], and learning what it means to be a hero. He is able to harness Lord Blazer's power and transform into [[Knight Blazer]] during battle.

title: brad_evans
body: One of the three founding members of ARMS in [[Wild Arms 2]], alongside [[Ashley Winchester]] and [[Lilka Eleniak]]. Brad used to be a soldier for Slayheim who helped the kingdom win the Slayheim Liberation War. Afterwards, the kingdom had no use for its soldiers and arrested him as a war criminal. Brad is initially forced to join ARMS, but he remains with the team willingly after bonding with the other members.

title: kanon_(wild_arms_2)
body:
A monster hunter who joins ARMS during the events of [[Wild Arms 2]]. Her real name is [[Aisha Bernadette]], and is a distant descendant of the Sword Magess [[Anastasia Valeria]]. Her home was attacked by monsters when she was young, leaving her with a near-destroyed body. She attached cybernetic extremities to herself, changed her name to Kanon, and began working as a monster hunter. She mainly joins ARMS to slay Lord Blazer, which resides within [[Ashley Winchester]].

Both this and the Aisha Bernadette tags should be used whenever she is in the picture.

title: clive_winslett
body: One of [[Virginia Maxwell]]'s companions in [[Wild Arms 3]], and the oldest. He is the most calm and composed of them all, often taking things into consideration before acting. This makes Clive hesitant at times, but it's his attention to detail that helps the team survive through some difficult situations. His manner is gentlemanly, despite his profession as a monster and criminal hunter. Clive is married to Catherine Winslett and has a daughter named Kaitlyn.

title: gallows_carradine
body: One of [[Virginia Maxwell]]'s teammates in [[Wild Arms 3]]. Gallows is a lively but immature Baskar priest who becomes a Drifter to escape his priestly duties, much to his grandmother's annoyance. This makes Gallows the best magic user of the team - he also has the highest HP. He often flirts with the ladies, and is easy-going and carefree with his life. [[Shane Carradine]] is his effeminate-looking younger brother.

title: janus_cascade
body: The first antagonist seen in [[Wild Arms 3]], Janus is a notoriously overconfident Drifter who hunts for treasure with his two partners [[Dario Nicolodi]] and [[Romero Gigio]]. Unlike typically arrogant people, Janus can live up to his boasts most of the time due to his fighting talents and street smarts. He expresses affection for [[Virginia Maxwell]], calling her 'Princess' (or 'Ojou-san' in Japan) and primarily fighting her team for her attention. Unfortunately, Janus has the bad habit of betraying his comrades for selfish reasons, which leaves him at the Three Prophets' mercy in the end. Janus' character design and weapon are inspired from [[Wild Arms 2]]'s [[Ashley Winchester]].

title: marina_irington
body: The love interest of [[Ashley Winchester]] in [[Wild Arms 2]]. She runs a bakery in Meria and constantly worries about his well-being while he is away on missions. She gets mad when he has to leave, but understands his job and wishes the best for him. Somehow, Marina is a fan of [[Vash the Stampede]].

title: altaecia_valeria
body: [[Irving Valeria]]'s twin sister in [[Wild Arms 2]], and a direct descendant of [[Anastasia Valeria]]. She makes small appearances as ARMS' top chef who provides meals for the group, and is Irving's top supporter for his cause. Altaecia's role becomes surprisingly bigger towards the end.

title: irving_valeria
body: [[Altaecia Valeria]]'s twin brother in [[Wild Arms 2]], and is also [[Anastasia Valeria]]'s descendant. Irving is a wealthy nobleman who bought ARMS and made it into a guerrilla force assembled to combat the terrorist organization Odessa. He is unable to participate in combat due to previous injuries, but he remains a capable leader throughout. Irving's dream with ARMS is to unite the three nations of Filgaia, helping them set aside their differences to fight a common enemy.

title: dario_nicolodi
body: One of [[Janus Cascade]]'s partners in [[Wild Arms 3]], along with [[Romero Gigio]]. Despite his rough appearance, Dario is cowardly and tends to be abused by Janus. Dario and Romero leave Janus after being swept away in a windstorm and presumed dead, but both are seen alive later.

title: romero_gigio
body: One of [[Janus Cascade]]'s partners in [[Wild Arms 3]], along with [[Dario Nicolodi]]. Romero fights like a ninja but is as cowardly as Dario, leading Janus to abuse them both. Dario and Romero leave Janus after being swept away in a windstorm and presumed dead, but both are seen alive later.

title: alfred_schrodinger
body: [[Maya Schrodinger]]'s younger brother in [[Wild Arms 3]]. He uses bombs and explosives in battle. Alfred often tells the main party that Maya is a good person deep within.

title: shady_thousand
body: An anthropomorphic cat that accompanies [[Maya Schrodinger]] in [[Wild Arms 3]]. Not much is known about Shady except he was summoned by her father and kept in a box for many years, making him claustrophobic. Maya released him, and he's traveled with her out of gratitude. Shady's character is based off the Schrödinger's cat experiment.

title: antenora_victoria
body: One of the members of Coctyus in the terrorist organization Odessa in [[Wild Arms 2]], and Vinsfeld Rhadamanthus' love interest. Her name means 'traitors to country'. [spoiler]Antenora's family was killed by Vinsfeld Rhadamanthus during the Slayheim Liberation War, and she chose a unique way to exact revenge; making him fall in love with her, then deliberately dying at ARMS' hand to make Vinsfeld experience the same loss.[/spoiler]

title: judecca_ducet
body: One of [[Wild Arms 2]]'s antagonists, a ruthless member of Coctyus who is shown to be psychotic and callous about his actions. Judecca has no respect for human beings and murders them for no apparent reason. [spoiler]When he is confronted for his actions, he commits suicide.[/spoiler] His name means 'traitor to masters'. Judecca also appears in episode 15 of [[Wild Arms Twilight Venom]].

title: oyama_reiji
body: See [[ooyama_reiji]].

title: annie_hamilton
body:
A character from the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series. Annie Hamitlon is a British woman born into a wealthy family and trains in martial arts. While she is overbearing and snobbish due to her spoiled upbringing, she loves animals and children, and owns several different kinds of pets. She has a romantic interest in [[Keith Wayne]], and it's implied later in the series that they are a couple.

Her son is [[Chris Wayne]], who was featured in Groove On Fight.

title: angela_belti
body:
One of the characters of the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series. 

Angela Belti is a large Italian woman who falls in love very easily. She fights using her brute power, body, and whip, and also sings in a band of musicians. In the very first game, she had a very muscular body, likely meant to parody wrestler-type characters. In the sequel, she was redesigned closer to her official artwork to where she looks more feminine.

She has two grand aunts, [[Elizabeth Belti]] and [[Sandra Belti]], who have made a debut in the latest game in the series, [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i].

title: jude_maverick
body: The protagonist of [[Wild Arms 4]], and the youngest hero of them all. Jude is immature at times due to living a sheltered life, but possesses a good heart. When Jude loses his hometown, he sets off to find survivors and to protect [[Yulie Ahtreide]]. Later, his purposes changes to protecting Filgaia. Jude is the only party member who can use ARMS.

title: yulie_ahtreide
body: The main heroine of [[Wild Arms 4]] and the younger sister of [[Kresnik Ahtreide]], Yulie is an orphan who had been cruelly experimented on while living in the White Orphanage. She was intended to activate the Divine Weapon, a forbidden ARM, but she escaped and met up with [[Jude Maverick]], resulting in the attack on his hometown. Yulie copes with the guilt of involving him and the others, as well as having to fight against Kresnik.

title: white_buffalo
body:
One of the characters in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series by [[Atlus]].

White Buffalo is a Native-American Indian who is a part of the Amiyai tribe and trains in martial arts. He is a quiet man, but he has a habit of taking anything that interests him for his 'collection', which can sometimes get him in trouble with the other descendants. He also seems to dislike children.

title: werner_maxwell
body: He is the father of [[Wild Arms 3]]'s heroine [[Virginia Maxwell]]. Werner went missing a long time ago and Virginia sets off to find him, though that isn't her only goal.

title: kaitlyn_winslett
body: The daughter of [[Clive Winslett]] in [[Wild Arms 3]]. Kaitlyn doesn't make many appearances, but it's obvious that Clive cares deeply for his wife and daughter.

title: kresnik_ahtreide
body: The brother of [[Wild Arms 4]]'s heroine [[Yulie Ahtreide]]. Kresnik is a commander of the Brionac forces who doesn't like [[Jude Maverick]] immediately due to his natural ability to use ARMS - Kresnik must take drugs in order to wield ARMS. However, he cares deeply for Yulie and asks Jude to take care of her in his stead.

title: leehalt_alcaste
body: One of the antagonists in [[Wild Arms 3]], and the leader of the Three Prophets. He is well-versed in ancient technology, and seems to know a lot about [[Jet Enduro]]'s past.

title: malik_bendict
body: One of the Three Prophets in [[Wild Arms 3]], an unpredictable and heartless man who is often responsible for sucking out the Guardians' life force. [spoiler]Malik's real purpose is to resurrect his deceased mother using Yggdrasil's technology.[/spoiler]

title: melody_vilente
body: The only female member of the Three Prophets in [[Wild Arms 3]]. Melody only concerns herself with physical beauty, and [[Clive Winslett]] remarks on her true ugliness.

title: dean_stark
body: The main hero of [[Wild Arms 5]], a young man who wishes to leave his secluded hometown and become a Golem Hunter. He is friends with [[Rebecca Streisand]], and they find the amnesiac [[Avril Vent Fleur]]. Dean agrees to help Avril regain her memory while chasing his dreams, living on the motto, "You can do anything as long as you don't give up."

title: avril_vent_fleur
body: One of the main heroines of [[Wild Arms 5]]. Avril is a mysterious and beautiful young woman whom [[Dean Stark]] and [[Rebecca Streisand]] discover inside a Golem's arm. She travels with them seemingly like a lost puppy, but exudes wisdom beyond her years. Avril fight with a sword ARM that can turn into a whip.

title: chuck_preston
body: A handsome-looking and boastful young man from [[Wild Arms 5]] who actually gets frightened under pressure. He is a Golem Hunter who pursues [[Greg Russellberg]] because he destroys the Golems that Chuck is hoping to excavate. Chuck fights with a piledriver ARM.

body:
One of the characters of the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

Kanji Kokuin is a blood relative of the Gouketsuji family who was at one point married to Oume, but due to the abuse he suffered, he soon divorced her. As such, he wanted revenge. He is a perverse old man who loves seeing girls in pretty dresses and employs crude and sometimes gross attacks, such as farting at his opponents or attacking them with his loincloth. He also is able to transform into a hulking, muscular version of himself.

title: katrina_elesius
body:
[[Alexia Lynn Elesius]]'s younger sister in [[Wild Arms XF]]. Even though Alexia has gone missing, Katrina cannot inherit the Elesius kingdom for two reasons; her inability to communicate with Filgaia's Guardians, and her mental disorder where she cannot experience fear. The Elder Statesmen use her as a puppet ruler and damage her self-confidence. Despite her inability, they improperly perform traditional rites and ceremonies for Katrina to hear the Guardians.

[spoiler]Instead, a malevolent entity called the Clysmian of Fear enters her body and manifests over time with doses of terror that thrill Katrina. The Clysmian grows so strong that it wants to experience the world's terror at once, leading to the game's final battle - a battle that Katrina does not survive.[/spoilers]

title: alexia_lynn_elesius
body:
The elder Princess Royal of the Elesius Kingdom in [[Wild Arms XF]] and [[Katrina Elesius]]'s older sister, who is presumed dead after a landslide. Alexia cannot communicate with Filgaia's Guardians, so she had to be removed from the line of succession. [[Clarissa Arwin]] almost looks like Alexia's twin, so she impersonated as Alexia [spoiler] until it was revealed the princess was alive and in captivity.[/spoiler]

Even though Alexia and Clarissa look almost alike, they are NOT twin sisters, so the 'twins' tag shouldn't be used. To tell the two apart, Alexia often has short blonde hair, wears a pink knight's outfit, and wields a sword.

title: felius_arwin
body: The adopted brother of [[Clarissa Arwin]] in [[Wild Arms XF]]. He comes off as quiet, blunt and mysterious, but is a powerful fighter who will protect Clarissa and their friends. Felius feels responsible for Melissa Arwin's murder because he gave her the sword Iskender Bey, which her killer [[Rupert Dandridge]] desired.

title: levin_brenton
body: Levin is a former student of [[Labyrinthia Wordsworth]] and a member of the powerful Brenton noble family in [[Wild Arms XF]]. Levin has dreams of being a hero and impressing [[Clarissa Arwin]] (whom he believes is [[Alexia Lynn Elesius]]), but ends up being brash and reckless. Levin proved to be bad with the sword, so he studied magic instead.

title: labyrinthia_wordsworth
body: A former advisor for the Elesius Kingdom before the events of [[Wild Arms XF]] begin. Labyrinthia is branded a traitor and forced to flee. She meets [[Clarissa Arwin]] and encourages her to impersonate as [[Alexia Lynn Elesius]] for the kingdom's sake. Labyrinthia is incredibly intelligent, but seems to be having a mid-life crisis, as she always says, "I may not look it, but I'm actually the complete package; strength, smarts, and beauty!"

title: ragnar_blitz_lebrett
body: A Drifter in [[Wild Arms XF]] who hates the Elesius Kingdom for its expansionist attitude towards neighboring countries, which throws his life into constant chaos and death. Ragnar tried to infiltrate the Elder Statesmen by working as a guardsman, but left after witnessing its corruption. [[Clarissa Arwin]] meets him by chance, and he decides to fight with her to return peace to the kingdom.

title: gouketsuji_otane
body:
One of the characters of the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

Otane Gouketsuji is the twin sister of Oume Gouketsuji, but unlike her, she is generally friendlier in contrast to her sister, though she still has a very competitive spirit. She is able to transform into a youthful version of herself for a short time by draining one's life force, a technique she shares with her sister.

In her childhood, Otane was bullied constantly by Oume, and ran away from home to train in the mountains for when she can win the seat of clan leader and get her revenge on her sister. They do not get along with each other and often rival each other for the leadership. Unlike her sister, who simply desires power, Otane fights so that she can have happiness in her life.

In official artwork after the first game, the identities of the twins are never made clear. Further adding confusion, the colors of their clothes were switched around after [i]Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Toukon Matrimelee[/i], as previously, Otane wore purple and yellow. It was later changed to green and purple, which was Oume's previous color scheme.

title: rupert_dandridge
body: An antagonist in [[Wild Arms XF]] who murdered [[Clarissa Arwin]]'s mother to obtain a powerful sword called Iskender Bey. Rupert works for the Elder Statesmen as a 'law enforcer', though he's really just a bully. Clarissa's main reason for going to the Elelsius Kingdom is to find him and retrieve the sword.

title: mao_(disgaea)
body:
Mao is the main character of Disgaea 3.

Mao is the son of the Overlord, who rules the Evil Academy. Mao has never been to school since it began, making him the top Honor Student with a 1.8 million Evil Quotient (E.Q.). But ever since his father stepped on his Slaystation Portable, he vowed to defeat him for what he did. He becomes a hero by stealing Almaz von Almadine Adamant's hero title, and spend a majority of the game going back and forth into his Heart to give the title back.

Other than Mao's fascination (if not sexual pleasure and uncontrollable drooling) with rare specimens to experiment on, Mao is a typical demon: He cares not for other problems unless he benefits and takes what he wants by force.

body:
Hänsel, along with [[gretel_(black_lagoon)|Gretel]] are two unnamed Romanian twin orphans from [[Black Lagoon]].

Unknown to most people, [[hansel_(black_lagoon)|"Hänsel"]] and [[gretel_(black_lagoon)|"Gretel"]] are actually two personalities alternately adopted by the two children, both of whom suffer from Dissociative Identity Disorder, meaning they swap being "Hänsel" and "Gretel" with each other from time to time.

title: choujuu_giga
body:
鳥獣戯画 ([i]Choujuu-Giga[/i], Scrolls of Frolicking Animals) is the abbreviated name of 鳥獣人物戯画 ([i]Choujuu-Jinbutsu-Giga[/i], Scrolls of Frolicking Animals and Humans), a set of four picture scrolls created in the 12th~13th century.
The first scroll is considered to be Japan's first manga.
The [[frog]]s printed on [[Moriya Suwako]]'s dress were taken from these scrolls.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C5%8Dj%C5%AB-jinbutsu-giga

title: ornate
body:
Any object that is inscribed with an intricate design but is not limited to purely ornamental value, although it can include objects of purely ornamental value. This can be applied to weapons, armor, clothing, vehicles, etc.

Although Fantasy designs tend to incorporate ornateness into the design, this should be tagged if the ornateness is readily apparent. This also doesn't mean that the design is impractical, since the ornateness may be related to magical runes or enchantments.

title: sir_arthur_(makaimura)
body:
[b]Sir Arthur[/b] ([b]アーサー[/b]) is the main character from [[capcom|Capcom's]] [[Makaimura]] series.

Sir Arthur is a knight on a quest to rescue [[guinevere (makaimura)|Princess Guinevere]] from the evil clutches of Astaroth, king of the Demon World. Along the way he has to fight zombies and other evil demons, while collecting power ups and weapons to defeat all of his enemies. When hit hard enough his armor falls apart and he is left only in his strawberry-printed boxer shorts.

title: zaku_ii_f/j
body:
This tag encompasses the most recognizable [[Zaku]] variants from the [[Gundam]] franchise. The F and J-type are near indistinguishable except for the lack of verniers on the J-type, which is designed for ground combat. However, the original design of the F-type is identical to that of the J-type thus making it difficult to distinguish the two. 

For Danbooru purposes, these different models should be treated as one and the same.

title: fujiwara_no_mokou_(phoenix)
body:
[[Fujiwara no Mokou]] as a [[phoenix]]. While Mokou isn't an actual phoenix, she is frequently associated with them due to being a pyrokinetic immortal and producing a phoenix-shaped aura with some of her spellcards.

Depictions of Mokou as a phoenix are usually [[chibi]]-styled, and either include [[Ex-Keine]] as a [[sukusuku hakutaku]] or group Mokou with chibi-bird form versions of Touhou's bird-youkai characters.

title: kokonoe_reiji
body: Character in [[Kodomo no Jikan]], he is [[Kokonoe Rin]]'s cousin and father-figure. An office worker who excessively dotes on Rin, including donning an apron to cook for her. Shares a mutual distrust towards [[Aoki Daisuke]], Rin's teacher and crush. Once lover of [[Kokonoe Aki]].

title: oyajima_(kodomo_no_jikan)
body: Character in [[Kodomo no Jikan]], another male teacher alongside [[Aoki Daisuke]]. A sturdy man with seemingly closed/squinted eyes, he is an accomplished cook (better than his female peers), and one of the most open towards his cold colleague [[Shirai Sae]].

title: rotary_cannon
body:
Invented at the eve of the American Civil War, the Gatling Gun was a hand-cranked multiple-barrel gun loaded by a gravity hopper system. Though not automatic in operation, it was a direct ancestor of today's [[machine gun|machine guns]]. Dr. Richard J. Gatling's eponymous design is still used in weapon systems such as the M-61 Vulcan, the GAU-8, and the M134 (more popularly known as the Minigun). Use this tag when the weapon in question has more than two or three barrels. Gatling Guns have since been redubbed rotary cannons.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "Gatling Gun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gatling_gun

title: green_rose
body: A type of rose that does not occur in nature. Symbolism for this flower is not widely identified but could be associated with common themes for green, such as fertility and jealousy.

title: purple_rose
body: While dark purple and indigo roses do not exist due to the lack of blue pigmentation, light lilac roses do and can represent enchantment, desire and caution.

title: pink_rose

title: orange_rose

title: white_rose

title: jatimatic
body:
A Finnish 9x19mm [[submachine gun]] developed in the late 1970s-early 1980s. Its design used an angled bolt and placed the pistol grip in line with the barrel axis, helping mitigate recoil during automatic fire. It used straight magazines of 20 or 40 rounds each.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jatimatic

title: pps
body:
The PPS (Russian: ППС - "Пистолет-пулемёт Судаева" or "Pistolet-pulemjot Sudaeva", in English: "Sudaev's submachine-gun") was a family of Soviet submachine guns chambered in 7.62x25mm Tokarev, developed by Alexei Sudayev as a low-cost personal defense weapon for reconnaissance units, vehicle crews and support service personnel.

See also:
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPS_submachine_gun

title: ramirez_do_everything
body:
An internet [[meme]] born out from the 2009 game [[Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2]]. In the game, Sgt. Foley orders the player, as James Ramirez, to perform various tasks no less than 56 times, such as marking targets for artillery strikes or blowing up enemy vehicles or rescuing VIPs. The [[meme]] involves Ramirez being ordered to perform a variety of bizarre or impossible tasks, such as "Ramirez, destroy that nuke with a knife."

Unless this [[meme]] has a crossover with something Japanese, its off-topic and shouldn't be posted.

title: chris_lightfellow
body: One of the three initial playable protagonists in [[Gensou Suikoden III]]. She is a knight of Zexen given the nickname "Silver Maiden" and praised as a hero, though she isn't terribly proud of the admiration. She can technically become the new Flame Champion by acquiring the True Fire Rune, but canonically, she receives the True Water Rune.

title: grammaton_cleric
body:
In the movie [[Equilibrium]], the Grammaton Clerics are the elite enforcers of the government of Libria, tasked with hunting down and eliminating "sense offenders," those who refuse to take the emotion-deadening drug known as Prozium. They are particularly well known for their training in the firearm-based martial art known as [[gunkata]]. 

[[John Preston]], the protagonist of the movie, is a Cleric who comes to turn against his government after rediscovering the ability to feel.

title: nyanpire
body:
にゃんぱいあ -The Gothic World of Nyanpire-

A 2009 doujin by [[yukiusa]], adapted into a 2011 anime by GONZO.

The story follows a black cat who was abandoned and left to starve. Just before the cat's life was to be extinguished, a vampire emerged from the darkness and gave it blood. Now, "[[nyanpire_(character)|Nyanpire]]", it lives as a seemingly ordinary house cat raised by a human girl.

h4. Characters

* [[Chachamaru (Nyanpire)|Chachamaru]]
* [[Dokuganryuu Masamunya]]
* [[Misaki-chan]]
* [[Nyanpire_(character)|Nyanpire]]

title: gamepad
body:
The classic gamepad is a [[game_controller]] that can be held conveniently in two hands and does not require any particular mounting surface nor an exact fixed posture from the user. The game pad provides basic functions to control a game such as Start/Pause, Select, 4- or 8-way navigation, and various different actions via other buttons (numbering from two to roughly a dozen). Among the first gamepads were those game controllers bundled with the U.S.-market [[NES|Nintendo Entertainment System]] or Japanese-market [[Famicom]].

Videogame consoles through the 8-, 16- and 32-bit eras still feature gamepads as basic controllers and these may include analog thumbsticks. However, gamepads should be considered separate from [[joystick|joysticks]].

body:
A 1960s-era remotely-piloted [[helicopter]] used for antisubmarine warfare on small naval vessels. Considered expendable and built largely with commercial off-the-shelf electronics, the [[UAV]] was powered by a single engine driving 20 ft (6.10m) coaxial rotors. title: kanata_(trinity_universe)
body: For generations, Kanata’s ancestors have protected the Netheruniverse by transmogrifying into a Demon God Gem. However, Demon God King Kanata refused to become the gem and instead became a Demon Dog King. Since then, he has enjoyed a carefree life in hiding, but he eventually began thinking about the toll of his decision. Accepting the title of Demon God King and becoming the gemstone will stop space debris from crashing into his world. If he could get to the source of the space debris and solve the problem, everybody will be happy. Determined, Kanata goes on a journey to save his world.

title: hare_of_inaba
body:
因幡の白兎 / 稻羽之素菟 ([i]Inaba no Shiro Usagi[/i])

"from Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hare_of_Inaba

[b]Kojiki version[/b]

a hare tricks some sharks into being used as a land bridge, in order to travel from the Island of Oki to Cape Keta. He challenges the sharks to see whose clan is larger—the sharks or the hares—by having the sharks lie in a row across the sea. The hare then hopped across them, counting them as he went. Nearing the end, the hare exclaims that he has deceived the sharks in order to use them as a bridge. The last shark attacks the hare, ripping his fur from him. The god Ōkuninushi with his eighty brothers was travelling through the area to visit princess Yakami. While the brothers were on their way to visit the princess, the flayed hare stopped them and asked them for help. They told the hare to wash in the sea and dry itself in the wind, which naturally caused great pain for it. Ōkuninushi then met the hare, and he told it to bathe in fresh water and then roll in the pollen of cattail. The hare immediately got better, and it revealed its true form as a god. In gratitude, the hare told Ōkuninushi that Yakami would be his.



[b]Ise ga Naru version[/b]

Long ago, when Japanese goddess Amaterasu and her group traveled around at the boundary of Yakami in Inaba, they were looking for a place for their temporary palace, suddenly a white hare appeared. The white hare bit Amaterasu's clothes and took her to an appropriate place for a temporary palace along Nakayama mountain and Reiseki mountain. About two hours' walk, accompanied by the white Hare, the Amaterasu group reached a mountain top plain, which is now called Ise ga naru. Then, the white Hare disappeared at Ise ga naru. The place of this legend is in Yazu town and Tottori city, in Tottori Prefecture (ancient Inaba and Houki).

title: alternate_eye_color
body:
When a character is drawn with eyes of a different hue from the canonical color. A type of artistic license and should not be considered an error. 

* Examples: 
** [[Hong Meiling]] is often depicted with green eyes instead of the canonical blue eyes.

If a character's eye color is inconsistent in the official material ([[Izayoi Sakuya]] has been shown with both red and blue eyes, [[Kochiya Sanae]] has been shown with both gold and blue eyes, etc.), only apply this tag for colors that do not appear in any official works. Do [b]not[/b] confuse this tag with [[heterochromia]], and do not apply this tag if the work is [[monochrome]] or colored in a way such that characters only have one color each or share the same eye color, such as post #573149 and post #867976.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: ujikintoki_ginka
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Formerly a youkai in the form of a silver coin (thus her hair color), she's now taken a human shape to serve as a [[maid]] for her master, [[Kamishiro Seren]], in the Karindou shop. At roughly 180 years old, she's often paired subordinately with her "twin" older sister, [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]].

Unlike her older sister, she is disciplined, responsible, does almost all the domestic chores... and can USUALLY keep her [[yuri]] tendencies under cover. (So that her prey doesn't see it coming when she's about to strike!)

h4. See Also

* [[Ginru]]

title: ujikintoki_kinka
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Formerly a youkai in the form of a gold coin (thus her hair color), she's now taken a human shape to serve as a [[maid]] for her master, [[Kamishiro Seren]], in the Karindou shop. At roughly 200 years old, she's often paired as a superior with her younger "twin" sister, [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]].

Unlike her sister, she is generally lazy, irresponsible, and overtly sex-crazed.  Although she slacks and teases, however, she does usually go out of her way to care for her "family".

h4. See Also

* [[Kinru]]

title: elza_straherz
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. 

Roughly two millennia in age and master/teacher as well as next-door-neighbor of [[Kamishiro Seren]]. 

Generally seen wearing a [[kimono]] and an [[hair_ornament|ornament]] in her [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with two raccoon tails drooping off it. She also has purple eyes that have rectangular irises, which supposedly signify she has the ability to become a sage, although she refuses to do so, as that would require giving up worldly pleasures, and she likes those very, very much.

Her personality often swaps between that of a wise elder and a lecherous old man, which goes along with the fact she's actually a [[futanari|hermaphrodite]].  (This is, however, by choice - she can alter her body, and made herself a hermaphrodite.)

She lives with [[Mifilinah Jegell]], a.k.a. "Mifi", who serves as her maid and pseudo-lover.  Because Mifi requires her virginity to keep her magical powers, Elza's unwillingness to consummate Mifi's love for her, and Elza's natural perversion are serious problems to Elza's self-control.

[[Aiina Foxrider]] is an older acquaintance of Elza's, and also a lover, who apparently wants to help Mifi and Elza get together, as well as join in on the love triangle, herself.

She also adopts [[Ran Straherz]] as a "younger sister" after Ran needs somewhere to live.  Ran's traumatic past with sexual deviants puts her completely at odds with the rest of her "family" full of pervs.

Elza also made medicine that lets her freely change from child form to adult form.  She seems to prefer the child form.

title: ginru
body: A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. These [[minigirl|little girls]] are actually automated defense systems built by [[Kamishiro Seren]] in the shape of a bunny-style [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]], supposedly made out of magic explosives and equipped with long-range vision and active sonar (along with optional extras). Though their stated purpose is to defend various parts of the Karindou shop, they can be seen causing trouble and antics with their [[Kinru]] sistren.

title: kinru
body: A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. These [[minigirl|little girls]] are actually automated defense systems built by [[Kamishiro Seren]] in the shape of a cat-style [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]], supposedly made out of magic explosives and equipped with infrared vision and a thermograph (along with optional extras). Though their stated purpose is to defend various parts of the Karindou shop, they can be seen causing trouble and antics with their [[Ginru]] sistren.

title: kagurazaki_haruno
body:
A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Not much is known about her so far, other than that she's a [[miko]] of the Kagurazaki family and current owner of [[kagurazaki_shizuki|Shizuki]].

She also appears to have boy trouble - she's infatuated with a guy who doesn't seem to notice her (because he's apparently surrounded by other women).

title: sachi_(raku_pix)
body: An [[original]] character by [[Raku Pix]]. A "Kuuko":http://obakemono.com/obake/kitsune/ (one step below Tenko) fox youkai [[miko]] with [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[black hair]] who has come to train [[Kagurazaki Shizuki]]. Though apparently very powerful in her demon form, she seems to tire easily.

body:
円 紀世子
Character from [[gilgamesh_(anime)|Gilgamesh]]. Kiyoko is about seventeen and was born before the Twin X terrorist attack, so she doesn't have the ability to use the Dynamis. title: chronicles_of_the_sword
body:
"This is another tale of souls and swords..."


Chronicles of the Sword is a mini-game or an alternate history mode in [[Soulcalibur III]], a strange mixture of fighting game and turn-based strategy. 
This mode features a real-time strategy play style, in which the player's and the enemy's units are stationed in several bases (called "strongholds") on the map. 
Each chapter has one or more victory conditions, which can be capturing the enemy's main stronghold,defeating a certain enemy general, or eliminating all enemies in a mission.

title: arshtat_falenas
body:
Arshtat Falenas (アルシュタート ファレナス) is a secondary character in [[Gensou Suikoden V]], ruler of the Queendom of Falena, wife of [[Ferid Egan]], sister of [[Sialeeds Falenas]], and mother of the game's playable protagonist, Prince [[Freyjadour Falenas]].

Years of political scheming by the country's two leading noble families wear at her conscience and patience, leaving her prone to psychotic outbursts fueled by the will and power of the sentient Sun Rune on her forehead. Some time prior to the beginning of Suikoden V, she loses control and turns the Sun Rune on the "rebelling" town of Lordlake, its extreme light and heat evaporating the town's namesake large lake and transforming the immediate vicinity into a dust bowl.

[spoiler]She is murdered relatively early in the game during a coup d'état by the Godwin family. Suffering a full psychotic break in which she murders her husband Ferid, she threatens to use the Sun Rune against the entire country. [[Georg Prime]], following a request from Arshtat and the now-deceased Ferid, murders Arshtat before she can use the Sun Rune again.[/spoiler]

title: f(x)
body:
f(x) (Korean: 에프엑스; pronounced /ˌɛf ˈɛks/) is a five member South Korean girl group formed by SM Entertainment in 2009. The name is a play on the mathematical notation for function, and when input with different 'x', there can be many different outcomes. f(x) strives to be the kind of girl group that can change and adapt to many situations. The group members have also been nicknamed "function girls". The quintet consists of Victoria, Amber, Luna, Sulli and Krystal.

title: tabard
body:
An official garment of a herald, emblazoned with a coat of arms or a symbol denoting membership. It is a sleeveless or short-sleeved coat/cloth worn over clothing or armor, either down the front or on the front and back. It is a purely cosmetic item intended to add individuality to someone's look, whereas a [[surcoat]] is designed to provide protection from the elements.

Mainly associated with [[Yakumo Ran]], [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s Imperishable Night outfit, and [[Ibaraki Kasen]].

h4.See also

* [[surcoat]]
* [[naked tabard]]

title: closed_umbrella
body: An umbrella or parasol that is not opened up.

title: surcoat
body:
A coat worn over garments. In the 12th century, knights formerly wore surcoats over their armor until suits of plate armor were developed in the 15th century. The surcoat also protected them from poor weather, as well as reflecting heat from the sun. Like the [[tabard]], the surcoat can also bear the wearer's coat of arms.

The best examples in modern media are seen in the [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series.

h4.See also

* [[tabard]]

title: anja_(madoka_magica)
body:

The Anja seen in the show is a lost familiar who was separated from the witch while playing alone, absorbed in her daydreams. Anja's duty is to be naïve. She possesses the ability to transform humans into [[ball]]s; a human who has been transformed into a ball cannot revert to human form until he bounces against the ground once for each lie that he has ever uttered. 

Anja travels around in a vehicle that can assume several different forms, including an [[airplane]], a [[boat]], and a [[car]].

title: baking
body:
Any image centered around baking sweets, desserts and bread. An establishment entirely devoted to baking is a [[bakery]].

Similar to baking is [[cooking]], but it's said that, "Cooking is an art, while baking is a science." This is true, as baking recipes are far more stringent and don't allow for much manipulation, lest the product fails.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: ichiyanagi_nagomu_no_junan
body:
一柳和の受難 (Ichiyanagi Nagomu's Suffering)

A series of mystery games by "Full On Games":http://www.fog.jp/top.htm and [[Nippon Ichi]] starring [[Ichiyanagi Nagomu]] and [[Takatoo Hiori]].

First game in the series: "Amagoushi no Yakata (雨格子の館)":http://vndb.org/v8412
Second game in the series: "Naraku no Shiro Ichiyanagi Nagomu, 2dome no Junan (奈落の城 一柳和、2度目の受難)":http://vndb.org/v8411
Third game in the series: "Koori no Haka Ichiyanagi Nagomu, 3dome no Junan (氷の墓標 一柳和、3度目の受難)":http://vndb.org/v8410

* "Series official site":http://fog.nippon1.jp/nagomu/index.html

title: v-max
body:
The V-Max is a [[motorcycle]] model produced by [[Yamaha]]. This cruiser is one of the more muscular vehicles of its type and features quite distinctive styling.

See "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamaha_V-max. At this link, one may read the distinction between the original V-Max (produced 1985-2007) and its successor, the even more advanced and brutish VMAX (produced 2009-onward).
